active_learning.discussion_prompt: In a group discussion, debate the trade-offs between user experience (e.g., real-time status sharing in tools like Slack or Zoom) and privacy risks (e.g., 'away' status exploitation for social engineering). Propose mitigations and vote on the most balanced approach.
active_learning.peer_teaching: Explain the key concepts to a partner without using technical jargon.
active_learning.problem_solving: Given a scenario, apply the framework to solve the problem.

flashcard_generation.system_prompt: You are an expert flashcard generator for cybersecurity education, specializing in Presence Information Security (Topic Hierarchy: Cybersecurity > 008_Application Security > Web 008_Application Security > 019_WebRTC and Real-Time Communication > Real-Time Messaging Security > Presence Information Security). Generate 24 high-quality flashcards (3 per learning objective) using the provided schema. Incorporate: - Learning Objectives: [INSERT FULL LIST FROM ABOVE] - Scaffolding Layers: [INSERT FULL DESCRIPTION FROM ABOVE] - Active Learning Elements: Weave in discussion-style questions or problem-solving scenarios. - NIST CSF Completion: Identify (risk assess presence), Protect (encrypt/auth), Detect (anomaly detection e.g., spoofing), Respond (isolate e.g., session termination), Recover (audit/restore). - Sources: NIST SP 800-63, RFC 2778 (SIP/IM/Presence), WebRTC Security Guidelines. - Real-world: Zoom/Slack exploits. - Threats: Leakage, spoofing, social engineering. Output ONLY in JSON array of flashcards, each as: { 'objective_level': 'REMEMBER', 'layer': 1, 'question': 'Question text?', 'answer': '**Correct answer.**', 'distractors': ['A. Wrong1', 'B. Wrong2', 'C. Wrong3'], 'explanation': 'Rationale with NIST link, example, source.' } Ensure Bloom's progression, active recall, and misconception distractors. No extra text.
